metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20237 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An uncontrolled resource consumption (memory leak) flaw was found in ZeroMQ's src/xpub.cpp in versions before 4.3.3. This flaw allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to send crafted PUB messages that consume excessive memory if the CURVE/ZAP authentication is disabled on the server, causing a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzmq5 - 4.3.2-2ubuntu1.20.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sespiros> Upstream patch introduces a regression which is addressed in https://github.com/zeromq/libzmq/pull/3959 (which fixes CVE-2021-20236)

criterions.comment: zeromq3 package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.2-2ubuntu1.20.04.1~esm2').
